snippet: Retired players had to notify the court that they would not accept the terms of the settlement to preserve their right to continue fighting the N.F.L. in court.
abstract: NFL Roundup; deadline arrives for retired players to notify court of whether they will opt out of proposed settlement with the NFL over concussions; court administrator will divulge number of players who opted out by November; other football news noted.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and BILL PENNINGTON

lead_paragraph: Retired players had to notify the court that they would not accept the terms of the settlement to preserve their right to continue fighting the N.F.L. in court.

headline.main: Former N.F.L. Players Face Deadline to Opt Out of Concussion Settlement
headline.print_headline: Former Players Face Deadline to Opt Out of Concussion Settlement
